column1: Smoque BBQ////I advised getting the rib dinner combo. With it
column2: you can also add in brisket and pulled pork for a couple more dollars with the combo. It's really good for sharing since you get the most out of it. The baby back ribs here are fantastic! It's very moist
column4: and falls off the bone. When they cooked it
column5: they soak it up in the bbq sauce and it instantly melts in your mouth. It's bomb! Droollllll... However
column6: I find the St.Louis to be too dry for my liking. The meat was a bit rough. No bbq sauce on it. It's a dry rub. It wasn't as tender as the baby back ribs. Also
column7: I tried their mac&cheese and cornbread for their sides and it was very tasty.
